channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-17833] Publish split generation counters
item.description: With TEZ-3856, tez counters are exposed via input initializers which can be used to publish split generation counters.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: cc/ aplusplus sershe
The patch is small if we ignore the q test out.
Nit: it appears that getVertexCounterName will be called a lot, perhaps the config setting should be saved somewhere in the caller and passed as an arg, w/o config?

Another nit: probably cheaper to check hashset first, then check the FS, even if it means adding more paths to the hashset
Also, what's the logic behind isFile - what if it's not a file?

Addressed review comments. Removed pom.xml changes. Will update it once tez makes a release until then this patch can't be committed anyway.

2 counters one for #files that will be read by input and other for #directories (did not call it partitions as we are not checking with partition spec). #directories comes from jobConf via mapred.input.dir. So only #files has to make sure the path in split is a file. There can be OrcSplit with delta directory, which is not accounted for in any of these counters (expensive to do list status on each delta directories here).
Unit test case for triggers based on input counters has to be enabled after HIVE-17778 and TEZ-3856

Nit: is it possible to rename reason in OperationState etc to elaborate what the reason is for?
Can be fixed on commit
+1 pending tests
sershe Commented in wrong jira? Can you please transfer your vote to HIVE-17888
Ok I rescind my +1
Is there a RB?
Attaching RB link

sershe Not sure if you had reviewed this before. The +1 seems to be for a different jira. Can you please take a look at this patch? Now that master has already updated tez version, we can get this patch committed.
Couple of non-nits on RB
Addressed review comments.

-1 overall
